title: Build issue: ld: library not found for -lgcc_s
body_html:
Issue description

I'm trying to build pytorch, and have tried both with and without CUDA. Both fail. I get the error:

ld: library not found for -lgcc_s
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[2]: *** [lib/libcaffe2.dylib] Error 1
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2

The output from the install script can be found here

Also, some of the steps I'd taken to try and get it to work had been detailed in this issue on discuss.

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Pytorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
    export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/Users/askates/anaconda3/envs/torch_gpu/
    conda install numpy pyyaml mkl mkl-include setuptools cmake cffi typing
    MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 python setup.py install
  • OS: OSX 10.12.6
  • PyTorch version: most recent master
  • Python version: 3.5.5
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0/6.0
  • GPU models and configuration: NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.5.0
  • CMake version: 3.12.0
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Thanks, it's driving me nuts not being able to install any new versions of pytorch. Namely because I am currently experiencing something akin to this issue but am unable to attempt to fix it.

body:
## Issue description

I'm trying to build pytorch, and have tried both with and without CUDA. Both fail. I get the error:
```
ld: library not found for -lgcc_s
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[2]: *** [lib/libcaffe2.dylib] Error 1
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
```
The output from the install script can be found [here](https://gist.github.com/alexskates/e911aa975efe45fabed19702c6353183)

Also, some of the steps I'd taken to try and get it to work had been detailed in [this issue on discuss](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/keeps-referencing-wrong-version-of-gcc-when-building-from-source/19492/4).

## System Info
- PyTorch or Caffe2: Pytorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):  
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/Users/askates/anaconda3/envs/torch_gpu/
conda install numpy pyyaml mkl mkl-include setuptools cmake cffi typing
MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 python setup.py install
- OS: OSX 10.12.6
- PyTorch version: most recent master
- Python version: 3.5.5
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0/6.0
- GPU models and configuration: NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.5.0
- CMake version: 3.12.0
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Thanks, it's driving me nuts not being able to install any new versions of pytorch. Namely because I am currently experiencing something akin to [this issue](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/199) but am unable to attempt to fix it.
